info.title: Katana
info.description: This is Katana Slice Manager Swagger for documenting Katana's NBI REST APIs. You can find more about Katana Slice Manager at [Katana Github page](https://github.com/medianetlab/katana-slice_manager).

tags.description: Create, Read, Update and Delete Network Slices

post.summary: Configure Katana using one JSON File

base_slice_des_id.description: Id of the slice descriptor which will be used as base for the gst

base_slice_des_ref.description: Reference to an added slice descriptor which will be used as base for the gst

coverage.description: A list with all the locations that are part of the slice

items.description: The location name for each site in the slice

availability.description: This parameter describes if the network slice supports deterministic communication.

periodicity.description: This parameter provides a list of periodicities supported by the network slice.

deterministic_communication.description: This attribute defines if the network slice supports deterministic communication for periodic user traffic. Periodic traffic refers to the type of traffic with periodic transmissions.

network_DL_throughput.description: The achievable data rate in downlink for the whole network slice (and not per user).

ue_DL_throughput.description: This attribute describes the guaranteed data rate supported by the network slice per UE in downlink

network_UL_throughput.description: The achievable data rate in uplink for the whole network slice (and not per user).

ue_UL_throughput.description: This attribute describes the guaranteed data rate supported by the network slice per UE in uplink

group_communication_support.description: 0: not available 1: Single Cell Point to Multipoint (SCPTM) 2: Broadcast/Multicast 3: Broadcast/Multicast + SC-PTM

isolation.description: A network slice instance may be fully or partly, isolated from another network slice instance. 0: No Isolation 1: Core Isolation 2: RAN Isolation 3: Both Isolation

mc_service.description: This attribute specifies whether or not the network slice supports MC push-to-talk, MC data, MC video, Isolated E-UTRAN Operation for Public Safety or MC interworking.

items.description: 1: MCPTT 2: MCData 3: MCVideo 4: IOPS 5: MC interworking

mission_critical_support.description: Mission-critical (MC) leads to a priority of the network slice relative to others, for C-plane and U-plane decisions.

mmtel_support.description: This attribute describes whether the network slice supports IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS) and Multimedia Telephony Service MMTel.

nb_iot.description: This parameter describes whether NB-IoT is supported in the network slice.

number_of_connections.description: This attribute describes the maximum number of concurrent sessions supported by the network slice.

number_of_terminals.description: This attribute describes the maximum number of concurrent terminals supported by the network slice.

availability.description: Describes if this attribute is provided by the network slice and contains a list of positioning methods provided by the slice.

items.description: 1: CID 2: E-CID (LTE and NR) 3: OTDOA (LTE and NR) 4: RF fingerprinting 5: AECID 6: Hybrid positioning 7: NET-RTK

positional_support.description: This attribute describes if the network slice provides geo-localization methods or supporting methods.

radio_spectrum.description: Defines the radio spectrum supported by the network slice.

items.description: This attribute simply tells which frequencies can be used to access the network slice. Example: n1, n77, n38

simultaneous_nsi.description: 0: Can be used with any network slice 1: Can be used with network slices with same SST value 2: Can be used with any network slice with same SD value 3: Cannot be used with another network slice 4-15: operator defined class

qos.description: This attribute defines all the QoS relevant parameters supported by the network slice, based on 3GPP defined standard values (5QIs)

qi.description: Based on the table of defined 5QI by 3GPP

resource_type.description: 0: GBR (Mission Critical Video user plane) 1: Delay critical GBR (Intelligent Transport Systems) 2: Non-GBR (Voice, AR)

priority_level.description: Associated with 5G QoS characteristics indicates a priority in scheduling resources among QoS Flows.

packet_delay_budget.description: The Packet Delay Budget (PDB) defines an upper bound for the time that a packet may be delayed between the UE and the UPF [Seconds].

packet_error_rate.description: The Packet Error Rate (PER) defines an upper bound for the rate of packets that are not successfully delivered by the corresponding receiver [percentage].

jitter.description: Jitter is defined as a variation in the delay of received packets [Seconds].

max_packet_loss_rate.description: the maximum rate for lost packets of the QoS flow that can be tolerated in the uplink (UL) and downlink (DL) direction [percentage].

device_velocity.description: 1: Stationary: 0 km/h 2: Pedestrian: 0 km/h to 10 km/h 3: Vehicular: 10 km/h to 120 km/h 4: High speed vehicular: 120 km/h to 500 km/h

terminal_density.description: maximum number of connected and/or accessible devices per unit area (per km2) supported by the network slice [Number/km^2]

base_slice_des.description: This is the schema for the core part of the new slice

ns_list.description: List of the NSD to be instantiated alongside the slice

nsd-id.description: The NSD id as defined on the NFVO

placement.description: 1: Deploy on Core - 2: Deploy on all Edge locations of the cloud - Explicitily define a string location (it must be included in the Slice Coverage

service_descriptor.description: This is the schema for the Service Descriptor part of slice IM

probe_list.description: A list of probe ids to be included in the slice

availability.description: List of KQIs and KPIs available for monitoring

items.description: 1: Throughput 2: Latency 3: Service Request Success Rate

performance_monitoring.description: This attribute provides the capability to monitor KQIs and KPIs.

availability.description: List of KQIs and KPIs available for monitoring

items.description: 1: Throughput 2: Latency 3: Service Request Success Rate

performance_prediction.description: This attribute provides the capability to predict KQIs and KPIs.

test_descriptor.description: This is the schema for the Test Descriptor part of slice IM

DB_ID.description: The uuid of the component used by katana DB

Component_ID.description: The uuid of the component as registered to katana by the admin

_id.description: The uuid that is used for storing the NSI in the database

coverage.description: A list with all the locations that are part of the slice

items.description: The location name for each site in the slice

network_DL_throughput.description: The achievable data rate in downlink for the whole network slice (and not per user).

ue_DL_throughput.description: This attribute describes the guaranteed data rate supported by the network slice per UE in downlink

network_UL_throughput.description: The achievable data rate in uplink for the whole network slice (and not per user).

ue_UL_throughput.description: This attribute describes the guaranteed data rate supported by the network slice per UE in uplink

group_communication_support.description: 0: not available 1: Single Cell Point to Multipoint (SCPTM) 2: Broadcast/Multicast 3: Broadcast/Multicast + SC-PTM

mission_critical_support.description: Mission-critical (MC) leads to a priority of the network slice relative to others, for C-plane and U-plane decisions.

mc_service.description: This attribute specifies whether or not the network slice supports MC push-to-talk, MC data, MC video, Isolated E-UTRAN Operation for Public Safety or MC interworking.

items.description: 1: MCPTT 2: MCData 3: MCVideo 4: IOPS 5: MC interworking

mmtel_support.description: This attribute describes whether the network slice supports IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS) and Multimedia Telephony Service MMTel.

nb_iot.description: This parameter describes whether NB-IoT is supported in the network slice.

number_of_connections.description: This attribute describes the maximum number of concurrent sessions supported by the network slice.

number_of_terminals.description: This attribute describes the maximum number of concurrent terminals supported by the network slice.

positional_support.description: This attribute describes if the network slice provides geo-localization methods or supporting methods.

availability.description: Describes if this attribute is provided by the network slice and contains a list of positioning methods provided by the slice.

items.description: 1: CID 2: E-CID (LTE and NR) 3: OTDOA (LTE and NR) 4: RF fingerprinting 5: AECID 6: Hybrid positioning 7: NET-RTK

radio_spectrum.description: Defines the radio spectrum supported by the network slice.

items.description: This attribute simply tells which frequencies can be used to access the network slice. Example: n1, n77, n38

qos.description: This attribute defines all the QoS relevant parameters supported by the network slice, based on 3GPP defined standard values (5QIs)

qi.description: Based on the table of defined 5QI by 3GPP

resource_type.description: 0: GBR (Mission Critical Video user plane) 1: Delay critical GBR (Intelligent Transport Systems) 2: Non-GBR (Voice, AR)

priority_level.description: Associated with 5G QoS characteristics indicates a priority in scheduling resources among QoS Flows.

packet_delay_budget.description: The Packet Delay Budget (PDB) defines an upper bound for the time that a packet may be delayed between the UE and the UPF [Seconds].

packet_error_rate.description: The Packet Error Rate (PER) defines an upper bound for the rate of packets that are not successfully delivered by the corresponding receiver [percentage].

jitter.description: Jitter is defined as a variation in the delay of received packets [Seconds].

max_packet_loss_rate.description: the maximum rate for lost packets of the QoS flow that can be tolerated in the uplink (UL) and downlink (DL) direction [percentage.

device_velocity.description: 1: Stationary: 0 km/h 2: Pedestrian: 0 km/h to 10 km/h 3: Vehicular: 10 km/h to 120 km/h 4: High speed vehicular: 120 km/h to 500 km/h

terminal_density.description: maximum number of connected and/or accessible devices per unit area (per km2) supported by the network slice [Number/km^2]

probe_list.description: A list of probe ids to be included in the slice

status.description: Init, Peovisioning, Activation, Running or Terminating

connections.description: A list of 5G service connections. Each connection contains a core and a radio endpoint. The endpoints are selected from the platform fanctions repository of the Slice Manager

items.description: A 5G service connections. Each connection contains a core and a radio endpoint. The endpoints are selected from the platform fanctions repository of the Slice Manager

core.description: The Core part of the 5G service connection

_id.description: The uuid of the function that is used in the database

id.description: A unique ID of the function

shared.description: Defines if the function can be shared between different slices

max_shared.description: Max number of slices - If availability is true and max_shared not defined, it will be assumed unlimited availability

ns_list.description: Conditional - If type == Virtual - A list of the NSs that will be part of the slice

nsd-id.description: The NSD id as defined on the NFVO

pnf_list.description: Conditional - If type == Physical - A list of the PNFs that will be part of the slice

pnf-id.description: A Unique ID of the pnf

ip.description: The management IP of the PNF

ip_s1.description: Optional - The IP of the S1 Interface

ems-id.description: Optional - Defines the EMS that is responsible for D1&2 configuration

functions.description: A list of all the functions that are used in the slice

conf_comp.description: The items components that have been configured by the ems

ns_list.description: A list of the instantiated NSs

nsd-id.description: The NSD id as defined on the NFVO

vnfd_list.description: The list of VNFDs in the NSD

placement_loc.description: Detailed info regarding the placement of the NS

location.description: The location where the NS is running

vim.description: The VIM ID of the location where the NS is hosted

vims.description: The list of VIMs used for the NS

wim_data.description: The data that was sent to WIM

slice_sla.description: Slice parameteres as defiend in NEST

network_DL_throughput.description: The achievable data rate in downlink for the whole network slice (and not per user).

network_UL_throughput.description: The achievable data rate in uplink for the whole network slice (and not per user).

core_connections.description: List of connections that are part of the slice and must be implemented by the WIM

core.description: The core part of the radio connection

ns.description: A list of VIMs where the NSs have been instantiated

pnf.description: A list of the PNFs that are part of the slice

pnf-id.description: A Unique ID of the pnf

ip_s1.description: Optional - The IP of the S1 Interface

radio.description: The core part of the radio connection

pnf-id.description: A Unique ID of the pnf

ip.description: The management IP of the PNF

ip_s1.description: Optional - The IP of the S1 Interface

extra_ns.description: A list of VIMs where the NSs that are not part of the core slice have been instantiated

name.description: The name for the new VIM

version.description: The version of the VIM's OS

infrastructure_monitoring.description: Optional - The URL of the Prometheus system that is responsible for monitoring the VIM

config.description: Optional parameters regarding the VIM operation - example: Security group

name.description: The name for the new NFVO

version.description: The version of the NFVO's OS

config.description: Optional parameters regarding the NFVO operation - example: network: flat

name.description: The name for the new WIM
The name for the new EMS

VIMs.description: A list of all the available VIMs

shared.description: Availability to be shared amongst many network slices

pnf-id.description: A Unique ID of the pnf

ip.description: The management IP of the PNF

ip_s1.description: Optional - The IP of the S1 Interface

tenants.description: A list of Tenants using the PDU

url.description: The URL of the Policy Management System

description.description: A description for the Policy Management System

type.description: The type for new Policy Management System

id.description: A unique ID for this network function

name.description: Optional name for the network function

shared.description: Defines if the function can be shared between different slices

max_shared.description: Max number of slices - If availability is true and max_shared not defined, it will be assumed unlimited availability

ns_list.description: Conditional - If type == Virtual - A list of the NSs that will be part of the slice

pnf_list.description: Conditional - If type == Physical - A list of the PNFs that will be part of the slice

ems-id.description: Optional - Defines the EMS that is responsible for D1&2 configuration

other_required_functions.description: A list with the IDs of other functions that are required to be deployed along with this

other_supported_functions.description: A list with the IDs of other functions that can be deployed along with this

nsd-id.description: The NSD id as defined on the NFVO

pnf-id.description: A Unique ID of the pnf

ip_s1.description: Optional - The IP of the S1 Interface

_id.description: The id on the SM Database

nfvo_id.description: The id of the NFVO where the NSD is onboarded

nsd_id.description: The id of the NSD as it is stored in the NFVO

nsd_name.description: The name of the NSD as it is stored in the NFVO

vnfd_list.description: The list of VNFDs in the NSD

flavor.description: Total resource requirements for the NSD Deployment

instances.description: The number of VMs that will be deployed as part of the NS

memory-mb.description: The total amount of required RAM in megabytes

storage-gb.description: The total amount of required disk storage in gigabytes

vcpu-count.description: The total amount of required virtual cpus

vim.description: A list with the VIM components to be added

nfvo.description: A list with the NFVO components to be added
